justification: "Participants rated the pulse received on a scale, ranging from 0 (corresponding to 'no pain') to 10 ..." indicates that subjective pain intensity was captured with a 10-point VAS.
During outcome assessment, "participants were asked to rate the pain of the trial outcome on a 10-point scale," showing the same scale was used to gauge others’ pain.

measured_by: choice between gamble and sure option in the probabilistic pain task
justification: The Methods note that choices were coded as 0 = sure option, 1 = gamble and analysed with a binomial regression to model risk-seeking versus risk-averse behaviour.

measured_by: monetary bids (0–20 Monetary Units) entered after each choice
justification: "Participants were asked to bid on their selected option, by entering a price ranging from 0 to 20 MUs," demonstrating that the bid amount operationalised willingness-to-pay.
construct: Willingness to pay for pain avoidance
